text: In the house on the outskirts of a city, the wind blows the trees in the park. In the bedroom, a man on his second night of widowhood, eyes fixed on the ceiling, tries to fall asleep and erase the unusual loneliness. Out the open window, he hears, already in the midst of the noise, the mighty murmur of the foliage. Outside, a dead leaf rises between the blasts and flies around the house without lights. The man falls asleep, finally, overcome by memory. The leaf comes through the window and will land on the pillow. Without knowing it, the man dreams that he's not alone. On the wet pillow, the dead leaf saw that brief happiness, that night's imposture. UNCERTED ARMYS and other accounts, 1991
title: Exilio
author: Carlos María Gutiérrez
